name: long liner construction, steel | long liner, steel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21266/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of long liners, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW), Vessel dimensions: 28 - 38 m length.;System boundaries and relation between activities

Construction of vessels, including provision of all materials and work

Batteries are excluded, as they do not exist in the database. Gear materials were not included, considering that their relevance in weight is insignificant in long lining vessels as compared to trawlers or other net fisheries.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Global average based on data from Spain.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Global average based on data from Spain.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Valid for other long lining fisheries with vessel sizes ranging from 25-40 m. The activity is extrapolated from the respective European activity. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: A sample of 12 vessels of a population of 49 was modelled based on European geography.

exchanges.description: Construction of a steel long liner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW). Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW, adjusted for trawler's gear. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication.

flow.name: long liner, steel
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

exchanges.description: EOL of a steel long liner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW), at the end of its lifetime. Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW, adjusted for long liner's gear. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication. Includes engines and motors
